category.name: System
category.description: Basic system variables. Be sure that the values of these variables are the same across all machines in your installation.

variable.name: Name
variable.description: The name of this PLC installation. It is used in the name of the default system site (e.g., PlanetLab Central) and in the names of various administrative entities (e.g., PlanetLab Support).

variable.name: Shortame
variable.description: The short name of this PLC installation. It is mostly used in the web interface when displaying local objects.

variable.name: Root in Hierarchical Naming Space
variable.description: The root of this peer in the hierarchical federation naming space.

variable.name: Slice Prefix
variable.description: The abbreviated name of this PLC installation. It is used as the prefix for system slices (e.g., pl_conf). Warning: Currently, this variable should not be changed.

variable.name: Root Account
variable.description: The name of the initial administrative account. We recommend that this account be used only to create additional accounts associated with real administrators, then disabled.

variable.name: Root Password
variable.description: The password of the initial administrative account. Also the password of the root account on the Boot CD.

variable.name: Root SSH Public Key
variable.description: The SSH public key used to access the root account on your nodes.

variable.name: Root SSH Private Key
variable.description: The SSH private key used to access the root account on your nodes.

variable.name: Debug SSH Public Key
variable.description: The SSH public key used to access the root account on your nodes when they are in Debug mode.

variable.name: Debug SSH Private Key
variable.description: The SSH private key used to access the root account on your nodes when they are in Debug mode.

variable.name: Root GPG Public Keyring
variable.description: The GPG public keyring used to sign the Boot Manager and all node packages.

variable.name: Root GPG Private Keyring
variable.description: The SSH private key used to access the root account on your nodes.

category.name: Flavours
category.description: Defaults for nodes and slices contents.

variable.description: Allows to compute a virtualization mechanism from an fcdistro. Starting with 5.2 MyPLC has support for either 'vs' or 'lxc', and this gives a correspondance from the node's fcdistro to the right virtualization mechanism. This information is essentially used by the BootManager for getting the installation phase right like e.g. when partitioning disks, and not to figure the contents of the nodeimage that depend only on fcdistro, pldistro and of course arch. This can be overridden by setting the vrt tag on that particular node.

variable.name: arch for nodes
variable.description: The default 'arch' to use when installing nodes. This is offered mostly for consistency with the rest of the PLC_FLAVOUR category, but does not have much of a practical interest. In any case, you need to have the corresponding bootstrapfs images available for nodes.

variable.name: fcdistro for nodes
variable.description: THIS CURRENTLY HAS NO EFFECT. The default 'fcdistro' to use when installing nodes.You need to have the corresponding bootstrapfs images available for nodes. THIS CURRENTLY HAS NO EFFECT.

variable.name: pldistro for nodes
variable.description: The default 'pldistro' to use when installing nodes. You need to have the corresponding bootstrapfs images available for nodes.

variable.name: arch for slivers
variable.description: The default 'arch' to use for slivers. This is useful if you have heterogeneous nodes (i686 and x86_64), but want slivers to be homogeneous. You need to have the corresponding vserver variant rpm available for nodes.

variable.name: fcdistro for slivers
variable.description: The default 'fcdistro' to use for creating slivers. You need to have the corresponding vserver variant rpm available for nodes.

variable.name: pldistro for slivers
variable.description: The default 'pldistro' to use for creating slivers. You need to have the corresponding vserver variant rpm available for nodes.

variable.name: Primary DNS Server
variable.description: Primary DNS server address.

variable.name: Secondary DNS Server
variable.description: Secondary DNS server address.

category.name: DNS
category.description: MyPLC can provide forward DNS resolution for itself and for its nodes. To enable resolution for MyPLC itself, set the Primary DNS Server address to 127.0.0.1 and provide external IP addresses for the database, API, web, and boot servers below. To enable resolution for nodes, use the external IP address of this machine as the primary DNS server address for each node.

variable.name: Enable DNS
variable.description: Enable the internal DNS server. The server does not provide reverse resolution and is not a production quality or scalable DNS solution. Use the internal DNS server only for small deployments or for testing.

category.name: /etc/hosts
category.description: MyPLC can setup /etc/hosts with the hostnames and IP addresses specified for *_NAME and *_IP, or look up the IP addresses if they are not specified in this configuration.

variable.name: Enable /etc/hosts configuration
variable.description: Let PLC manage /etc/hosts

category.name: Mail
category.description: Many maintenance scripts, as well as the API and web site themselves, send e-mail notifications and warnings.

variable.name: Enable Mail
variable.description: Set to false to suppress all e-mail notifications and warnings.

variable.name: Support Address
variable.description: This address is used for support requests. Support requests may include traffic complaints, security incident reporting, web site malfunctions, and general requests for information. We recommend that the address be aliased to a ticketing system such as Request Tracker.

variable.name: Boot Messages Address
variable.description: The API will notify this address when a problem occurs during node installation or boot.

variable.name: Mom List Address
variable.description: This address is used by operations staff to monitor Mom (formerly pl_mom) messages indicating excessive BW or memory usage by a slice. Mom messages sent to slices will be cc'ed to this list so as not to clog the Support Address list.

variable.name: Slice Address
variable.description: This address template is used for sending e-mail notifications to slices. SLICE will be replaced with the name of the slice.

variable.name: Enabled
variable.description: Enable the database server on this machine.

variable.name: Type
variable.description: The type of database server. Currently, only postgresql is supported.

variable.name: Hostname
variable.description: The fully qualified hostname of the database server.

variable.name: IP Address
variable.description: The IP address of the database server, if not resolvable.

variable.description: The TCP port number through which the database server should be accessed.

variable.description: The name of the database to access.

variable.description: The username to use when accessing the database.

variable.name: Database Password
variable.description: The password to use when accessing the database. If left blank, one will be generated.

variable.name: Enabled
variable.description: Enable the API server on this machine.

variable.name: Debug
variable.description: Enable verbose API debugging. Do not enable on a production system!

variable.name: Hostname
variable.description: The fully qualified hostname of the API server.

variable.name: IP Address
variable.description: The IP address of the API server, if not resolvable.

variable.name: IP Subnet
variable.description: The IP Subnet for all API servers. Used to identify IPoD packet senders.

variable.name: IP Mask
variable.description: The IP Mask that should be applied to incoming packets to match the IP Subnet for IPoD packets.

variable.name: Port
variable.description: The TCP port number through which the API should be accessed.

variable.name: Path
variable.description: The base path of the API URL.

variable.name: Maintenance User
variable.description: The username of the maintenance account. This account is used by local scripts that perform automated tasks, and cannot be used for normal logins.

variable.name: Maintenance Password
variable.description: The password of the maintenance account. If left blank, one will be generated. We recommend that the password be changed periodically.

variable.name: Authorized Hosts
variable.description: A space-separated list of IP addresses allowed to access the API through the maintenance account. The value of this variable is set automatically to allow only the API, web, and boot servers, and should not be changed.

variable.name: SSL Private Key
variable.description: The SSL private key to use for encrypting HTTPS traffic. If non-existent, one will be generated.

variable.name: SSL Public Certificate
variable.description: The corresponding SSL public certificate. By default, this certificate is self-signed. You may replace the certificate later with one signed by a root CA.

variable.name: Root CA SSL Public Certificate
variable.description: The certificate of the root CA, if any, that signed your server certificate. If your server certificate is self-signed, then this file is the same as your server certificate.

variable.description: Enable the web server on this machine.

variable.name: Debug

variable.description: The fully qualified hostname of the web server.

variable.name: IP Address
variable.description: The IP address of the web server, if not resolvable.

variable.name: Port
variable.description: The TCP port number through which the unprotected portions of the web site should be accessed.

variable.name: SSL Port
variable.description: The TCP port number through which the protected portions of the web site should be accessed.

variable.description: The certificate of the root CA, if any, that signed your server certificate. If your server certificate is self-signed, then this file is the same as your server certificate.
